channel.title: CVE Feed for HackerOne -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for HackerOne -- all products

item.title: CVE-2017-16074|2024-09-17T01:42:04.209Z -- hackerone -- crossenv%20node%20module
item.description: crossenv was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2017-16115|2024-09-17T01:12:20.165Z -- hackerone -- timespan%20node%20module
item.description: The timespan module is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service. Given 50k characters of untrusted user input it will block the event loop for around 10 seconds.

item.title: CVE-2016-10684|2024-09-17T00:16:26.720Z -- hackerone -- healthcenter%20node%20module
item.description: healthcenter - IBM Monitoring and Diagnostic Tools health Center agent healthcenter downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested resources with an attacker controlled copy if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2016-10543|2024-09-17T00:22:05.189Z -- hackerone -- call%20node%20module
item.description: call is an HTTP router that is primarily used by the hapi framework. There exists a bug in call versions 2.0.1-3.0.1 that does not validate empty parameters, which could result in invalid input bypassing the route validation rules.

item.title: CVE-2016-10564|2024-09-17T01:26:03.354Z -- hackerone -- apk-parser%20node%20module
item.description: apk-parser is a tool to extract Android Manifest info from an APK file. apk-parser versions below 0.1.6 download binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16055|2024-09-17T01:10:56.654Z -- hackerone -- sqlserver%20node%20module
item.description: `sqlserver` was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2016-10536|2024-09-17T01:46:42.911Z -- hackerone -- engine.io-client%20node%20module
item.description: engine.io-client is the client for engine.io, the implementation of a transport-based cross-browser/cross-device bi-directional communication layer for Socket.IO. The vulnerability is related to the way that node.js handles the `rejectUnauthorized` setting. If the value is something that evaluates to false, certificate verification will be disabled. This is problematic as engine.io-client 1.6.8 and earlier passes in an object for settings that includes the rejectUnauthorized property, whether it has been set or not. If the value has not been explicitly changed, it will be passed in as `null`, resulting in certificate verification being turned off.

item.title: CVE-2017-16030|2024-09-17T00:41:28.696Z -- hackerone -- useragent%20node%20module
item.description: Useragent is used to parse useragent headers. It uses several regular expressions to accomplish this. An attacker could edit their own headers, creating an arbitrarily long useragent string, causing the event loop and server to block. This affects Useragent 2.1.12 and earlier.

item.title: CVE-2017-16057|2024-09-17T00:15:50.693Z -- hackerone -- nodemssql%20node%20module
item.description: nodemssql was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2017-16044|2024-09-17T00:21:50.833Z -- hackerone -- d3.js%20node%20module
item.description: `d3.js` was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2017-16175|2024-09-17T01:21:42.413Z -- hackerone -- ewgaddis.lab6%20node%20module
item.description: ewgaddis.lab6 is a file server. ewgaddis.lab6 is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2017-16023|2024-09-17T01:01:40.957Z -- hackerone -- decamelize%20node%20module
item.description: Decamelize is used to convert a dash/dot/underscore/space separated string to camelCase. Decamelize 1.1.0 through 1.1.1 uses regular expressions to evaluate a string and takes unescaped separator values, which can be used to create a denial of service attack.

item.title: CVE-2016-10631|2024-09-17T00:17:09.947Z -- hackerone -- jvminstall%20node%20module
item.description: jvminstall is a module for downloading and unpacking jvm to local system. jvminstall downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16071|2024-09-17T01:25:34.845Z -- hackerone -- nodemailer-js%20node%20module
item.description: nodemailer-js was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2016-10528|2024-09-17T01:30:39.884Z -- hackerone -- restafary%20node%20module
item.description: restafary is a REpresentful State Transfer API for Creating, Reading, Using, Deleting files on a server from the web. Restafary before 1.6.1 is able to set up a root path, which should only allow it to run inside of that root path it specified.

item.title: CVE-2017-16051|2024-09-17T01:36:13.920Z -- hackerone -- sqliter%20node%20module
item.description: `sqliter` was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2017-16120|2024-09-17T01:31:37.503Z -- hackerone -- liyujing%20node%20module
item.description: liyujing is a static file server. liyujing is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2017-16103|2024-09-17T01:11:53.088Z -- hackerone -- serveryztyzt%20node%20module
item.description: serveryztyzt is a simple http server. serveryztyzt is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the URL.

item.title: CVE-2017-16097|2024-09-17T00:30:39.731Z -- hackerone -- tiny-http%20node%20module
item.description: tiny-http is a simple http server. tiny-http is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2017-16017|2024-09-17T01:40:49.487Z -- hackerone -- sanitize-html%20node%20module
item.description: sanitize-html is a library for scrubbing html input for malicious values Versions 1.2.2 and below have a cross site scripting vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-16086|2024-09-17T00:31:35.528Z -- hackerone -- ua-parser%20node%20module
item.description: ua-parser is a port of Browserscope's user agent parser. ua-parser is vulnerable to a ReDoS (Regular Expression Denial of Service) attack when given a specially crafted UserAgent header.

item.title: CVE-2016-10682|2024-09-17T01:21:46.325Z -- hackerone -- massif%20node%20module
item.description: massif is a Phantomjs fork massif downloads resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested resources with an attacker controlled copy if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2016-10683|2024-09-17T01:11:32.095Z -- hackerone -- arcanist%20node%20module
item.description: arcanist downloads resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested resources with an attacker controlled copy if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2016-10630|2024-09-17T01:21:00.795Z -- hackerone -- install-g-test%20node%20module
item.description: install-g-test downloads resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks.

item.title: CVE-2017-16207|2024-09-17T01:21:18.986Z -- hackerone -- discordi.js%20node%20module
item.description: discordi.js is a malicious module based on the discord.js library that exfiltrates login tokens to pastebin.

item.description: serverliujiayi1 is a simple http server. serverliujiayi1 is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the URL.

item.description: ffmepg was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2017-16016|2024-09-17T01:46:48.797Z -- hackerone -- sanitize-html%20node%20module
item.description: Sanitize-html is a library for scrubbing html input of malicious values. Versions 1.11.1 and below are vulnerable to cross site scripting (XSS) in certain scenarios: If allowed at least one nonTextTags, the result is a potential XSS vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-16196|2024-09-17T00:42:07.189Z -- hackerone -- quickserver%20node%20module
item.description: quickserver is a simple static file server. quickserver is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2016-10606|2024-09-17T00:55:44.362Z -- hackerone -- grunt-webdriver-qunit%20node%20module
item.description: grunt-webdriver-qunit is a grunt plugin to run qunit with webdriver in grunt grunt-webdriver-qunit downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2014-10067|2024-09-17T00:11:12.478Z -- hackerone -- paypal-ipn%20node%20module
item.description: paypal-ipn before 3.0.0 uses the `test_ipn` parameter (which is set by the PayPal IPN simulator) to determine if it should use the production PayPal site or the sandbox. With a bit of time, an attacker could craft a request using the simulator that would fool any application which does not explicitly check for test_ipn in production.

item.title: CVE-2017-16049|2024-09-17T01:46:17.496Z -- hackerone -- nodesqlite%20node%20module
item.description: `nodesqlite` was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2017-0898|2024-09-17T01:36:46.258Z -- hackerone -- ruby
item.description: Ruby before 2.4.2, 2.3.5, and 2.2.8 is vulnerable to a malicious format string which contains a precious specifier (*) with a huge minus value. Such situation can lead to a buffer overrun, resulting in a heap memory corruption or an information disclosure from the heap.

item.title: CVE-2016-10553|2024-09-17T00:16:46.372Z -- hackerone -- sequelize%20node%20module
item.description: sequelize is an Object-relational mapping, or a middleman to convert things from Postgres, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite and Microsoft SQL Server into usable data for NodeJS. A fix was pushed out that fixed potential SQL injection in sequelize 2.1.3 and earlier.

item.title: CVE-2016-10554|2024-09-17T01:55:55.539Z -- hackerone -- sequelize%20node%20module
item.description: sequelize is an Object-relational mapping, or a middleman to convert things from Postgres, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite and Microsoft SQL Server into usable data for NodeJS. Before version 1.7.0-alpha3, sequelize defaulted SQLite to use MySQL backslash escaping, even though SQLite uses Postgres escaping.

item.title: CVE-2016-10576|2024-09-17T01:21:20.514Z -- hackerone -- fuseki%20node%20module
item.description: Fuseki server wrapper and management API in fuseki before 1.0.1 downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested resources with an attacker controlled copy if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16021|2024-09-17T01:46:00.192Z -- hackerone -- uri-js%20node%20module
item.description: uri-js is a module that tries to fully implement RFC 3986. One of these features is validating whether or not a supplied URL is valid or not. To do this, uri-js uses a regular expression, This regular expression is vulnerable to redos. This causes the program to hang and the CPU to idle at 100% usage while uri-js is trying to validate if the supplied URL is valid or not. To check if you're vulnerable, look for a call to `require("uri-js").parse()` where a user is able to send their own input. This affects uri-js 2.1.1 and earlier.

item.title: CVE-2017-16118|2024-09-17T01:06:51.232Z -- hackerone -- forwarded%20node%20module
item.description: The forwarded module is used by the Express.js framework to handle the X-Forwarded-For header. It is vulnerable to a regular expression denial of service when it's passed specially crafted input to parse. This causes the event loop to be blocked causing a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2016-10643|2024-09-17T00:21:27.841Z -- hackerone -- jstestdriver%20node%20module
item.description: jstestdriver is a wrapper for Google's jstestdriver. jstestdriver downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2016-10639|2024-09-17T00:56:14.613Z -- hackerone -- redis-srvr%20node%20module
item.description: redis-srvr is a npm wrapper for redis-server. redis-srvr downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16099|2024-09-17T00:56:56.438Z -- hackerone -- no-case%20node%20module
item.description: The no-case module is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service. When malicious untrusted user input is passed into no-case it can block the event loop causing a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2016-10642|2024-09-17T00:26:32.715Z -- hackerone -- cmake%20node%20module
item.description: cmake installs the cmake x86 linux binaries. cmake downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16170|2024-09-17T01:55:38.101Z -- hackerone -- liuyaserver%20node%20module
item.description: liuyaserver is a static file server. liuyaserver is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2017-16035|2024-09-17T01:26:31.843Z -- hackerone -- hubl-server%20node%20module
item.description: The hubl-server module is a wrapper for the HubL Development Server. During installation hubl-server downloads a set of dependencies from api.hubapi.com. It appears in the code that these files are downloaded over HTTPS however the api.hubapi.com endpoint redirects to a HTTP url. Because of this behavior an attacker with the ability to man-in-the-middle a developer or system performing a package installation could compromise the integrity of the installation.

item.title: CVE-2016-10626|2024-09-17T00:17:29.653Z -- hackerone -- mystem3%20node%20module
item.description: mystem3 is a NodeJS wrapper for the Yandex MyStem 3. mystem3 downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16155|2024-09-17T00:35:58.830Z -- hackerone -- fast-http-cli%20node%20module
item.description: fast-http-cli is the command line interface for fast-http, a simple web server. fast-http-cli is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2017-16202|2024-09-17T01:46:24.524Z -- hackerone -- coffeescript%20node%20module
item.description: The cofeescript module exfiltrates sensitive data such as a user's private SSH key and bash history to a third party server during installation.

item.title: CVE-2017-16076|2024-09-17T00:06:15.829Z -- hackerone -- proxy.js%20node%20module
item.description: proxy.js was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.description: cypserver is a static file server. cypserver is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.description: serve46 is a static file server. serve46 is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.description: galenframework-cli is the node wrapper for the Galen Framework. galenframework-cli below 2.3.1 download binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.description: intsol-package is a file server. intsol-package is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2016-10676|2024-09-17T01:31:56.336Z -- hackerone -- rs-brightcove%20node%20module
item.description: rs-brightcove is a wrapper around brightcove's web api rs-brightcove downloads source file resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested resources with an attacker controlled copy if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16101|2024-09-17T01:41:09.946Z -- hackerone -- serverwg%20node%20module
item.description: serverwg is a simple http server. serverwg is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the URL.

item.title: CVE-2017-16212|2024-09-17T01:26:41.368Z -- hackerone -- ltt%20node%20module
item.description: ltt is a static file server. ltt is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2016-10549|2024-09-17T01:46:02.640Z -- hackerone -- sails%20node%20module
item.description: Sails is an MVC style framework for building realtime web applications. Version 0.12.7 and lower have an issue with the CORS configuration where the value of the origin header is reflected as the value for the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header. This would allow an attacker to make AJAX requests to vulnerable hosts through cross site scripting or a malicious HTML Document, effectively bypassing the Same Origin Policy. Note that this is only an issue when `allRoutes` is set to `true` and `origin` is set to `*` or left commented out in the sails CORS config file. The problem can be compounded when the cors `credentials` setting is not provided. At that point authenticated cross domain requests are possible.

item.title: CVE-2017-16029|2024-09-17T00:11:57.294Z -- hackerone -- hostr%20node%20module
item.description: hostr is a simple web server that serves up the contents of the current directory. There is a directory traversal vulnerability in hostr 2.3.5 and earlier that allows an attacker to read files outside the current directory by sending `../` in the url path for GET requests.

item.title: CVE-2016-10619|2024-09-17T00:56:48.996Z -- hackerone -- pennyworth%20node%20module
item.description: pennyworth is a natural language templating engine. pennyworth downloads data resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks.

item.title: CVE-2018-3733|2024-09-17T01:06:57.354Z -- hackerone -- crud-file-server%20node%20module
item.description: crud-file-server node module before 0.9.0 suffers from a Path Traversal vulnerability due to incorrect validation of url, which allows a malicious user to read content of any file with known path.

item.title: CVE-2016-10580|2024-09-17T01:21:50.851Z -- hackerone -- nodewebkit%20node%20module
item.description: nodewebkit is an installer for node-webkit. nodewebkit downloads zipped resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested zip file with an attacker controlled zip file if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16221|2024-09-17T01:36:50.872Z -- hackerone -- yzt%20node%20module
item.description: yzt is a simple file server. yzt is vulnerable to a directory traversal issue, giving an attacker access to the filesystem by placing "../" in the url.

item.title: CVE-2017-16119|2024-09-17T01:52:08.005Z -- hackerone -- fresh%20node%20module
item.description: Fresh is a module used by the Express.js framework for HTTP response freshness testing. It is vulnerable to a regular expression denial of service when it is passed specially crafted input to parse. This causes the event loop to be blocked causing a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2018-3726|2024-09-17T00:05:37.055Z -- hackerone -- crud-file-server%20node%20module
item.description: crud-file-server node module before 0.8.0 suffers from a Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability to a lack of validation of file names.

item.title: CVE-2017-16117|2024-09-17T01:16:46.857Z -- hackerone -- slug%20node%20module
item.description: slug is a module to slugify strings, even if they contain unicode. slug is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service is specially crafted untrusted input is passed as input. About 50k characters can block the event loop for 2 seconds.

item.title: CVE-2016-10608|2024-09-17T00:10:34.045Z -- hackerone -- robot-js%20node%20module
item.description: robot-js is a module for native system automation for node.js. robot-js downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2018-3730|2024-09-17T00:56:12.788Z -- hackerone -- mcstatic%20node%20module
item.description: mcstatic node module suffers from a Path Traversal vulnerability due to lack of validation of filePath, which allows a malicious user to read content of any file with known path.

item.title: CVE-2017-16052|2024-09-17T01:05:54.584Z -- hackerone -- node-fabric%20node%20module
item.description: `node-fabric` was a malicious module published with the intent to hijack environment variables. It has been unpublished by npm.

item.title: CVE-2016-10527|2024-09-17T01:16:35.976Z -- hackerone -- riot-compiler%20node%20module
item.description: The riot-compiler version version 2.3.21 has an issue in a regex (Catastrophic Backtracking) thats make it unusable under certain conditions.

item.title: CVE-2014-10064|2024-09-17T00:36:04.821Z -- hackerone -- qs%20node%20module
item.description: The qs module before 1.0.0 does not have an option or default for specifying object depth and when parsing a string representing a deeply nested object will block the event loop for long periods of time. An attacker could leverage this to cause a temporary denial-of-service condition, for example, in a web application, other requests would not be processed while this blocking is occurring.

item.title: CVE-2016-10595|2024-09-17T02:06:34.048Z -- hackerone -- jdf-sass%20node%20module
item.description: jdf-sass is a fork from node-sass, jdf use only. jdf-sass downloads executable resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested file with an attacker controlled file if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2017-16041|2024-09-17T01:55:33.643Z -- hackerone -- ikst%20node%20module
item.description: ikst versions before 1.1.2 download resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks.

item.title: CVE-2016-10533|2024-09-17T00:35:52.804Z -- hackerone -- express-restify-mongoose%20node%20module
item.description: express-restify-mongoose is a module to easily create a flexible REST interface for mongoose models. express-restify-mongoose 2.4.2 and earlier and 3.0.X through 3.0.1 allows a malicious user to send a request for `GET /User?distinct=password` and get all the passwords for all the users in the database, despite the field being set to private. This can be used for other private data if the malicious user knew what was set as private for specific routes.

item.title: CVE-2016-10520|2024-09-17T01:41:52.603Z -- hackerone -- jadedown%20node%20module
item.description: jadedown is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) when certain types of user input is passed in.

item.title: CVE-2016-10538|2024-09-17T01:36:47.221Z -- hackerone -- cli%20node%20module
item.description: The package `node-cli` before 1.0.0 insecurely uses the lock_file and log_file. Both of these are temporary, but it allows the starting user to overwrite any file they have access to.

item.title: CVE-2017-0902|2024-09-17T00:42:39.081Z -- hackerone -- rubygems
item.description: RubyGems version 2.6.12 and earlier is vulnerable to a DNS hijacking vulnerability that allows a MITM attacker to force the RubyGems client to download and install gems from a server that the attacker controls.

item.title: CVE-2017-16025|2024-09-17T01:12:03.298Z -- hackerone -- nes%20node%20module
item.description: Nes is a websocket extension library for hapi. Hapi is a webserver framework. Versions below and including 6.4.0 have a denial of service vulnerability via an invalid Cookie header. This is only present when websocket authentication is set to `cookie`. Submitting an invalid cookie on the websocket upgrade request will cause the node process to error out.

item.title: CVE-2016-10578|2024-09-17T01:11:45.242Z -- hackerone -- unicode%20node%20module
item.description: unicode loads unicode data downloaded from unicode.org into nodejs. Unicode before 9.0.0 downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks.

item.title: CVE-2016-10596|2024-09-17T00:40:50.717Z -- hackerone -- imageoptim%20node%20module
item.description: imageoptim is a Node.js wrapper for some images compression algorithms. imageoptim downloads zipped resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested tarball with an attacker controlled tarball if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2016-10673|2024-09-17T01:16:06.952Z -- hackerone -- ipip-coffee%20node%20module
item.description: ipip-coffee queries geolocation information from IP ipip-coffee downloads geolocation resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. This could impact the integrity and availability of the data being used to make geolocation decisions by an application.

item.title: CVE-2018-3714|2024-09-17T00:51:50.998Z -- hackerone -- node-srv%20node%20module
item.description: node-srv node module suffers from a Path Traversal vulnerability due to lack of validation of url, which allows a malicious user to read content of any file with known path.

item.title: CVE-2017-16028|2024-09-17T02:06:18.622Z -- hackerone -- react-native-meteor-oauth%20node%20module
item.description: react-native-meteor-oauth is a library for Oauth2 login to a Meteor server in React Native. The oauth Random Token is generated using a non-cryptographically strong RNG (Math.random()).

item.title: CVE-2016-10688|2024-09-17T01:51:52.519Z -- hackerone -- haxe3%20node%20module
item.description: Haxe 3 : The Cross-Platform Toolkit (a fork from David Mouton's damoebius/haxe-npm) haxe3 downloads resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested resources with an attacker controlled copy if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2016-10525|2024-09-17T01:01:50.306Z -- hackerone -- hapi-auth-jwt2%20node%20module
item.description: When attempting to allow authentication mode `try` in hapi, hapi-auth-jwt2 version 5.1.1 introduced an issue whereby people could bypass authentication.

item.title: CVE-2018-3712|2024-09-17T00:05:56.311Z -- hackerone -- serve%20node%20module
item.description: serve node module before 6.4.9 suffers from a Path Traversal vulnerability due to not handling %2e (.) and %2f (/) and allowing them in paths, which allows a malicious user to view the contents of any directory with known path.

item.title: CVE-2016-10637|2024-09-17T01:36:38.265Z -- hackerone -- haxe-dev%20node%20module
item.description: haxe-dev is a cross-platform toolkit. haxe-dev downloads binary resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks. It may be possible to cause remote code execution (RCE) by swapping out the requested binary with an attacker controlled binary if the attacker is on the network or positioned in between the user and the remote server.

item.title: CVE-2016-10535|2024-09-17T01:30:58.704Z -- hackerone -- csrf-lite%20node%20module
item.description: csrf-lite is a cross-site request forgery protection library for framework-less node sites. csrf-lite uses `===`, a fail first string comparison, instead of a time constant string comparison This enables an attacker to guess the secret in no more than (16*18)288 guesses, instead of the 16^18 guesses required were the timing attack not present.

item.title: CVE-2016-10597|2024-09-17T01:01:45.608Z -- hackerone -- cobalt-cli%20node%20module
item.description: cobalt-cli downloads resources over HTTP, which leaves it vulnerable to MITM attacks.
